snippet: Despite the recent parole of an inmate whose case was handled by Detective Louis Scarcella, the prosecution’s review of the detective’s work found no misconduct.
abstract: Brooklyn prosecutors release statement saying they have uncovered no misconduct after months-long review of work of retired New York City Detective Louis Scarcella, blamed by defense lawyers for scores of flawed convictions; incoming Brooklyn District Attorney Kenneth P Thompson, who has promised transparency on Scarcella investigation, says he will withhold comment until he takes office and reviews files.
lead_paragraph: Despite the recent parole of an inmate whose case was handled by Detective Louis Scarcella, the prosecution’s review of the detective’s work found no misconduct.

headline.main: No Wrongdoing Found Yet in Inquiry Into Scarcella, Brooklyn Prosecutors Say
headline.print_headline: No Wrongdoing Found Yet in Inquiry Into Detective, Motion by Prosecutor Says
